yep! feel free to join us in the voice chat. we are getting to know what this project is

systems needed:

1. to vet scams
2. subject-matter experts to vet founder proficiencies
3. encouraging projects to apply from all over -- decentralize the people we want to apply
4. KPIs -- but how do you trust that they're valid?
RE: #4 can we look at other successful projects comparable to the one that is applying and see/ ask what KPIs to be the best indicators of their success.

Open site data streams on chain -> connect segment and standardize the format for certain types of data like retention, monthly active users, etc

Then by doing this people can build funds that monitor and automatically invest based on these things
Yup 🧠 🧠 🧠
Love it and yea. I guess based on the space the project is operating in, that would determine the numbers we'd want to see before funding
I'm jotting down some ideas on growth/marketing in the figma file if anyone wants to add in!

@Antoinette send your email I will connnect you on SU

Here's what I think we should do going forward.

As @sherm8n said the primary goal is to get deal flow (applications). We also want to build a strong & aligned community.

It's a mix of marketing (probably on twitter) & a strong referral program. When you refer someone and they get funded you're rewarded.

How do you think we should go about this? Throw any idea. Want to get marketing figured out by this afternoon PST. Want to launch and make this go VIRAL in the afternoon PST!

Please contribute ideas

Gm y’all. I’ve been thinking about Hyperscale and what could make it special at this moment in time. #1- I *think* just like ConstitutionDAO, it’s about democratizing access to private market investing.  Isn’t that why we love Robinhood for the public markets?  So how do we build this for everyone who wants in? I think there is a powerful community in that.    #2- Finding founders is relatively easy in a world where everyone is building. But the everyday person doesn’t get to see YC level deals. In the early days how can we tap into these pre-existing accelerators? This is just so we build our chops at decision making as a community.
I’m ready to launch community👌
@sherm8n good to seee you! Hii
Hey Simba nice to meet you

Hey! I think partnering with different web3 communities would be helpful for the Hyperscale to get the word out. One of the cool ones is the Encode Club that educate people on blockchain/crypto and partner with L1/L2 protocols through hackathons
great idea on hackathons for promoting dealflow. send me a DM if you get a sec, have an off-topic question.
I was thinking about this too... would be interesting if existing and successful accelerators held advisory or council seats?? might help to draw in interest from founders as well.🤔
Sure just sent you a friend request

Hey marketing team! I went through the channel history and added the ideas you have been discussing into the Notion page, for easier viewing: https://www.notion.so/hyperscale/Marketing-c0da717c231946449674f6a089199291
We're launching tomorrow. I'll need your help setting things up for the community. Discord organization, clear DAO explanation, mods, etc. Look for the announcement about the launch tonight.
Using hackathosn to market / attract interested developers is a great idea!
Maybe even offering to help sponsor events in order to have contacts / scout for projects (which would really help the issue of not being able ot find good crypto projects)
Sponsoring can even mean having a specific crypto category as well
I'd suggest (⚡,🚀) or (⚡,📈) would be a better fit. ⚖ may be the most literal translation of the word, but not really the message 🙂

I like (⚡,🚀) and (⚡,📈). Yesterday there was some pushback about 🚀 being too associated with 'wen lambo' crypto. I also suggest that we allow for the emoji handle to evolve. Most emoji handles are static -- ours can change as we scale through different problems

Here's my first draft at a discord structure: https://hyperscale.notion.site/Discord-Channel-Tree-DRAFT-2de6d2ff10504539a7672b54cb1e4292

Welcome feedback/suggestions 👍

contributor-covenant translations are excellent value-add though. i like it
:OK:
FYI I love the token name HYPE

An example of framing what crypto uniquely amplified in terms of where the capital is. ‘Nerd compared to cool’ could be reframed to other terms — but basically in concept the crypto people enabling / funding crypto people through unique Hyperscale approach is an interesting angle. https://twitter.com/alexandr_wang/status/1467700652499365888?s=21

embeds.description:
Over the past 2 decades, the nerds have steadily accumulated more and more capital, to which they now rival the cool kids.

Crypto was one of the biggest shifts here, where nerds have almost exclusively accumulated $2T in capital.

6/n

messages.content: https://twitter.com/alexandr_wang/status/1467700653329842182?s=21

embeds.description:
What that means is the nerds are significantly more powerful today than ever before.

They always could build, but now they can get capital just by appealing to other nerds. They could always do this at a small scale (seed funding), but now you can get $B’s from other nerds.

7/n

can make even two: internal/external

@Marketing Our primary channel will be Twitter. We're going to incentivize virality by giving funds to those who share.

What this means is DAOs will fill out an application. We'll post the applications in a Twitter thread. The application in the thread that gets the most retweets will get funded. If someone retweets the application that gets funded they'll receive a portion of the investment. Hyperscale will give some of the invested in DAO's tokens to people who retweet.

We'll have a post that reads as follows:
**Receive up to 1 million USD by filling out this simple application. You’ll receive a decision within 1 week.**
**${application link}**
**We'll post your application below in the application thread.**
**The application below that gets the most retweets will receive the first round of funding.** **Also if you retweet the application that gets funded you'll get some of that DAO's tokens**

Every hour a bot will post the leaderboard based on retweets and the time left. This DAO competition will last for a week.

Other details:
Application includes
- One liner*
- Twitter username*
- Website link

Some other ideas for marketing that we’ve heard
- (3,3) but as (⚡, ⚡)
- Memes
- People post about Hyperscale (this would include threads and regular posts)

**What does everyone think? Where should we look for inspiration?**

Check out #bot-dev if you think you could help build this!!
Ello
Looks quite solid. Just a suggestion - Should we think of building a drop too? Something like party round did.
@Eric Zhu was behind this
Why would we have an NFT drop though?
memes are risky imo, it ***really*** defines the brand. the (x,x) gives people something to identify with.
This is all my opinion (highly subjective), ill refine my thoughts in a bit.
Catching up here, but what has been the discussion on leveraging the YC community? Bookface, for instance, in promoting? Certainly hacker news. I see a lot about twitter on notion and figma
Not necessarily an NFT drop. just thinking of a cool ass drop that gets the word out there super quick. Almost like a turbo boost and then it’ll settle down but we’ll get a good momentum.
An announcement tweet from @sama99 would do a lot
Is this competition exclusively funding DAOs? It isn't clear to me from the wording of the post
I think (⚡, ⚡) would be an effective way to spread the community. Although I generally agree that we should avoid memes / sensationalizing / encouraging speculation

Just making sure I understand - so the goal is to get the most retweets on one's app within the thread in order to get funded? So more influence one has on twitter, more likely they'll get most retweets thus most likely to get funded?
ofc
Yeah, launch something big with sam would def get a lot of attraction
Meme marketing only works with the right people
memes can be a buzzkill depending on how many personas the brand has imo. also the purpose of the meme is a huge deal. im prob overthinking it, at this point
Just texted Josh from Party round to join this : )
yep, exactly

A comment on the twitter post:

"Also if you retweet the application that gets funded you'll get some of that DAO's tokens", they are incentivized to retweet every application? 

Maybe we say, if you participate in retweeting any of the applications you will get $HYPE token once it is released? Thoughts from others?
$hype doesnt have meaning until it has a use, iirc. i dont know much about dao tokens
Eric summoned me
what is this
@sama99 @kevalin

same with the DAO tokens, but I think the point is just to get people excited about participating in the voting so that we get more retweets and reach more people. I think as long as people get a token, regardless of if they understand the tokenomics behind it, some will excited enough to retweet it.
"Tokens align network participants to work together toward a common goal — the growth of the network and the appreciation of the token." - Chris Dixon
your probably right on that, $HYPE/$HYPER also tends to bring excitement over a blanket statement like dao's token
guys pretty sure if we all quote cdixon enough we'll hit pmf
product market fit? idk

Had the same thought that it would encourage retweeting all the apps. What's making us so focused on going viral - are we concerned we won't get enough applications in? Would be better to place more focus on making sure quality companies and founders are voted for, not primarily based on influence to retweet.

I think going viral makes sense because then we are likely to get more applicants which would likely result in more "quality" applications, even if the average application is lower quality. 

But you bring up a good point, should we let twitter decide? ...Since its just the first investment, I don't think it matters too much. For the remaining investments we can have a more legit process that ensures higher quality companies get selected

True! I was thinking an announcement from Sam would be more than enough to get enough quality applicants in but that's just my hypothesis. Also, I would be okay with it not mattering much for the first investment but after reading Sam's first advice, makes sense that first set of companies will set the trajectory and determine success of the project. With all that said, I'm also still brainstorming what other options we have so open to other ideas unless it's too late to course correct.

great point! "The quality of the first set of companies will set the trajectory of and determine the success or failure of the project. Have a super, super high bar." - Sam

I'm not convinced twitter would pick a low quality project but there is definitely the potential for that.

What if we let the retweets count for half of the votes, and then in the discord we also have a voting process for the remaining half of the votes. More complicated to explain in a tweet but allows for us to have a larger say in what we pic. (This assumes we are more able to make the best investment decision... maybe just the mods have a vote for the remaining 50% of votes).
Definitely seems dangerous to relinquish control of the "super, super high bar" to the Twitterverse
wouldn't it favor other factors (existing twitter following, notoriety, controversy) over traditional risk factors (founder market fit, product, traction)?

Going back to Sam's advice in #announcements from an hour ago, we should be prioritizing funding orgs that:
1. are very very high quality
2. have exceptional founders
3. are thinking long term

I like the idea of creating Twitter virality by making it a competition, but it seems like that will only be a good way to fund a minority of the initial ~45 projects. It does not allow much control over, or likely incentivize, funding projects that align with the 3 points above.

@kevalin can you confirm whether we/Sam are still interested in funding ~45 orgs for V0.1 (or ~9 if the nominal funding is $1M)? And if so, is there a different structure planned to fund companies after the first Twitter winner?

Other potentially fast marketing pathways (not all my ideas):
- *Partner with existing web3 communities* (e.g. we get mentioned in another large Discord group full of founders)
- *Hyperscale member connections* (recommend to a friend!)
- *Partner with existing accelerators* (a group of proven founders who know other exceptional people; YC has been mentioned)
- *Host events, especially with high profile people* (Sam Altman, other influential web3 people who are connected with members of this Discord)
Exactly hahaha

My thoughts if you don't mind: if we are going to fund the most retweeted what if it gets taken over by bots, in the crypto community there're a shit ton of bots 

could we maybe have a thread for people to tag their favorite web3 startups? Then take it from there
Also I bet we have people here with huge newsletters (web3 or startup focused)  that won't mind give hyperscale a shout-out
Pinned a message.

@Marketing here's the message that I sent to the core. Explains why we're calling off this project.

> This marketing campaign—dubbed the “nuke”—has been set aside. This nuke version is too spammy. It’ll also be botted on Twitter. Not a good look. Will tarnish our reputation.

> We know it’d generate tons of hype. Many people will apply & join the community. Hyperscale isn’t ready. We need a strong product that we’ll build these viral loops into.

> We’re going to build these launch ideas into our product—a one-click DAO formation form & an investment marketplace. BTW our product is very open-ended. Need to trial investments and see what the DAOs & the community needs. These are just ideas in a direction: ecosystem support.

> Today we’re doing a small launch. The main objective is to get applications. We also want to grow the community. This is a small win that’ll rally everyone around phase #2 of Hyperscale.

Hopefully this gives some context. Main concern for twitter is being spammy and not having bot defensibility (because bot prevention is hard on twitter).

Also here's my response to some of the key points brought up after my announcement here.

> Although I generally agree that we should avoid memes / sensationalizing / encouraging speculation -@connorg 
Yup I agree. That's why there's no twitter airdrop or invested DAO share distribution.

> Just making sure I understand - so the goal is to get the most retweets on one's app within the thread in order to get funded? So more influence one has on twitter, more likely they'll get most retweets thus most likely to get funded? 
> - @kamran 
Yes. The byproduct of this is project awareness, more application, & rapid community growth.

> Maybe we say, if you participate in retweeting any of the applications you will get $HYPE token once it is released? Thoughts from others?
> - @nicklinck 
This goes against the no speculation principle that's core to Hyperscale

> Had the same thought that it would encourage retweeting all the apps. What's making us so focused on going viral - are we concerned we won't get enough applications in? Would be better to place more focus on making sure quality companies and founders are voted for, not primarily based on influence to retweet.
> 
> True! I was thinking an announcement from Sam would be more than enough to get enough quality applicants in but that's just my hypothesis. ........ late to course correct.
> - @kamran
We aren't concerned about getting apps in. Will already go fairly viral. Also accepting based on the "twitterverse" is a bad idea in retrospect. Twitter (and crowds in general) shouldn't really be investing. Weight of allocation should be track record based. Def going to select really high quality projects to start.

> @kevalin can you confirm whether we/Sam are still interested in funding ~45 orgs for V0.1 (or ~9 if the nominal funding is $1M)? And if so, is there a different structure planned to fund companies after the first Twitter winner?
> - @connorg 
We're going to deploy about 10 mill in V0.1. Haven't decided on the # of companies. Will be largely case dependent.

> could we maybe have a thread for people to tag their favorite web3 startups? Then take it from there
> - @nonfungiblemoyo 
Spoke about this with the core team. Too spammy.

Good ideas & feedback! Thanks very much!!
Pinned this BTW. Good direction.
Great! This makes a lot of sense. How can we help for today’s small launch? @kevalin
For sure, we can reach out to people on this
Once people tag i could go into the comment section and try to get them to apply or at least check out Hyperscale either ways we'll get feedback if they do or not

Just catching up here, so are we looking for applications to potentially fund right away or applications to test the application process? Basically, would it be helpful for us to submit applications as tests?

Once this launches (very soon!) we'll be looking for real applications. Right now there isn't a need for test applications afaik

Yup, I've got PR. I've started writing up some thoughts and will share around soon. As @kevalin said, the next two weeks are fairly low-key until the big ramp up. In the meantime, we'll begin preparing quotes, statements, releases
Do you need any assistance? Happy to take on tasks.

Just coming back on my suggestion for events made over the weekend. I have had some thoughts on how this could work;

One idea is the Hyperscaledao conference - investors attend, startups pitch. Morning sessions are based around sharing knowledge from experts and afternoon sessions highlight those looking for funding. Exhibitors in the breakouts are web3 companies.

messages.content: Added

Hey team, would be fantastic if you could start contributing to this press question list. Just suggest added questions. I'll review and merge everything that makes sense:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1OyyUAj0ZH1HyjnokWzpicyuqgnE2TeJO0wL5d1ooWK4/edit?usp=sharing

embeds.title: Press Statements
embeds.description: First, let’s just start by brainstorming all the questions we’re likely to receive:   How did the project start? Who’s backing this project? What excites you most about this project? Who gets the upside? What does the token do? Has anything like this been done before? What’s the end-goal of the p...

messages.content: Would it make sense to group the questions maybe into Simon Sinek's framework of WHY, HOW, WHAT? I think most questions would fall under one of the categories, giving the document a structure and answering them would also help us in further refining and developing the strategy for the project.
Done. Thank you @graham
That's a great idea @AlEtherX , let me think about it
matching the existing ethos of the founder (and face) seems wise
Some of the questions that press will ask will definitely exist outside of these questions, so we'll need a catch-all too though

The challenge i see with structuring it that way is that Press does not think with the same mental framework-- they think in categories. For allowing information to be clearly understood, you usually want to present it in the way that the consumer thinks about it
Nice job organizing questions by topic
^more thoughts and input would be really helpful
Added the following q to "investments" section: Do you prefer to invest in companies building on a specific blockchain?
can you guys help think of the most critical/tough/aggressive questions that may be asked? team needs to have some thoughtful responses prepared

Here's a little riff in response to your question. These could be posed by media and start-ups, hopefully in a more concise fashion than me 🙂 Question we may encounter: how do we plan on adding value to entrepreneurs with advice/feedback that’s better or at least competitive with tradfi firms? Savvy founders will often wait longer to secure funds if it means they can get Sam, Sequoia, A16z, and FF on the cap table. What’s special about our DAO and its members that will compel folks to want to not only take our money, but leverage our expertise and be a part of our community?

Some attempts at questions:

Do you have anything to offer other than cash?
Are you sure a community can be trusted to make smart decisions?
If a company needs money fast, have they already messed up?
Why only blockchain companies?
Will there be legal problems?
Are you exploiting naive founders & getting them to take a bad offer?
Isn't this really just Sam Altman's project, not some decentralized community making real decisions?
Question about Sam is good.
What value do you offer aside from quick funding decisions and community access?
Do members have legal liability if DAO/DAO-backed companies are sued?
1. DAOs are getting  this question quite often - how does it differ from ICOs?
2. Another one is if the  DAOs are going to own ownership in other companies or in other DAOs - what’s the regulatory / compliance / tax / securities related stance? Mainly legal ones.
I believe Sam is still looking into these questions^

3. From the recent experiment with ConstitutionDAO, one the biggest problem how terrible the gas fees on Eth and most people lost $$$ on just transactions. How are we planning to negate if we are going to build this on ETH? Especially for smaller amount token holders.
Q: Are you concerned high gas prices could hinder scalability?
It's inferred q is about building on eth

Not sure if this related to the Press, but we might need to answer question from the founder perspective.  I was fortunate enough to get access to capital from Social a capitals “Capital as a Service” even I was based out in the Middle East. It was quick / AI driven selection process, but we had some data (traction) to input to get through.  I can share more info if we are planning to build AI Engine / selection process.
Q: Are you concerned about a crypto bear market or macro economic downturn?
Depending on tokenomics, we should prepare for reduced DAO participation if markets turn bad. This is separate from the funding side. Many VCs were busier than ever during the pandemic.
BTW, added the above qs to the doc
great questions-- they've all been merged and streamlined in the doc
Looks great
gm
Discord PR
👆 Have Discord community you think should know about Hyperscale? Drop it here!

I’m gathering Twitter threads to share with high-profile people to post. Would love to see people create their own threads and share with me via DMs. Goal here: give these threads to high profile people and make them look cool/smart for backing an amazing project. Obviously we get great PR out of it
Often times they’re willing to post it, but just won’t to take the offer to write it. We’re gonna make it super easy for them
We’ve already got a lot of influencers we plan to target. We’re optimizing for greatest potential TARGET AUDIENCE reach
will be out of pocket this morning -- perhaps we should cross post in other channels or ping folks in here w/ decent social media followings to tweet^
gm @DonaldBullers @better.law -- check out graham's note
Sup?
Another tough question borne from #legacy-voting discussion. How will you prevent front running by lurking investors?
Similarly – Who has access to the information I include in my application? Are you making any commitment to confidentiality? Should I assume anything I include in my app will be effectively public?

We can add this question. But honestly, I don't view this as much of a problem. If people are taking funding from us it's becuase they want the name, reputation, support, and funding. You can't prevent from someone from going with another funding source. But you can make your support services so dominant that it's an irrelevant question. People gladly take tough terms at YC because of prestige, name recognition, and support.

YC (esp. in earlier years) went to great lengths to keep info on active batches from getting to outside investors pre-demo day (and VCs go to greater lengths to get the "YC List" ahead of time). Until you get to the point where you have a product and reputation that can withstand that onslaught, it's a problem worth considering.

yeah that's fair. i'm just saying that you're not going to win all of them. may be possible to ask teams who apply to have some type of one-week exclusivity (until it is determined if they receive funding or not). Not sure if that's reasonable or feasible though
agreed, won't win them all. Thought it was an interesting q because it is a possible attack vector and the media likes to ask about those : )

embeds.title: The killer app of web3 is governance experimentation
embeds.description: In the last few days, a web3 community emerged out of nowhere, self-organized, and built @HyperscaleFund (https://t.co/OAmBlYwh1D), a new experiment in investing. — Sam Altman (@sama) December 8, 2021 Last night, I joined a new investment fund.  The fund was conceived on Saturday, launched Monday and now

messages.content:
I know mostly the question is up for discussion not the answer, but here my view/possible answer to it anyways. 

In addition to speed, it could be: 

1. The cause: if we manage to get around the “accredited investor” clause, Hyperscale would allow the low & middle class to participate in the greatest wealth creation of our time. So far only the already-wealthy are allowed to participate in startup investments. 

2. Mentorship: Anybody who can add value, can join a DAO. If we build the right mentorship model we could be an unprecedented talent aggregator for our backed companies. Which would then automatically attract more startups wanting strategic equity funding from us. I wrote more about this here in the proposed MVP 1 for the mentorship product: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1zYYKFcjAnUbWouFqjb2lN4LzoeGrKYLw0xvLLSvF4SE/edit

embeds.title: Hyperscale Fund - Mentorship MVP 1.0
embeds.description: Hyperscale Fund - Mentorship MVP 1.0   Why Mentorship Providing value to startups in forms of mentorship and guidance, rather than simply giving out cash, is a strong differentiator in the crowded VC space. In the current environment VC money is abundant and valuations high. Here a good overview...

Hey! We need help building out the media outreach list. To be clear, these are people who we are ***going to*** reach out to. Please do not reach out until we're ready! This has to be a well-coordinated approach. Please add people to this list who we should definitely reach out to (and please add a note if you have a personal connection/relationship!)

There are two tabs to this document-- one for twitter, and one for emails. The twitter one is mostly about individual influencers. The email list is more for media outlets /reporters
